pullRequest.body:
Given a functor `F : C ‚•§ D` between categories equipped with Grothendieck topologies, the condition that `F` preserves covers (developed in the file `CategoryTheory.Sites.CoverPreserving`) does not obviously imply that `F` is a continuous functor (i.e. the precomposition with `F.op` of a sheaf is a sheaf). However, it becomes obvious if we require that `F` preserves 1-hypercovers of a suitable size.

The general definitions involving continuous functors have been moved from `Sites.CoverPreserving` to a new file `Sites.Continuous`.

---
- [x] depends on: #13004
- [x] depends on: #13011

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion IsLimit ((E.map F).multifork P) ‚âÉ IsLimit (E.multifork (F.op ‚ãô P)) := by rfl ```

```suggestion
# Cover-preserving functors between sites.

```

It would be helpful to have somewhere a warning about the explicit universe parameter in the definition of `Functor.IsContinuous`. I.e. it would be more precise to say "`F.IsContinuous.{w}`¬†means that precomposition with `F.op` preserves sheaves of `Type w` (and actually sheaves in any category `C` with `Category.{w} C`)", or something like that. 

(I know this comment doesn't really have anything to do with the main content of this PR, but I think it's worth improving documentation here.)

Thanks very much for the reviews! Indeed, this PR is also motivated by an attempt to get a condition on Grothendieck topologies (the preservation of 1-hypercovers) which would imply `Functor.IsContinuous.{w}` for any `w`!

I have tried to add comments about these auxiliary universes in the docstring of the file.
There are some typos here in the universes.

```suggestion
/-- If `F : C ‚•§ D`, `P : D·µí·µñ ‚•§ A` and `E` is a 1-pre-hypercover of an object of `X`,
then `(E.map F).multifork P` is a limit iff `E.multifork (F.op ‚ãô P)` is a limit. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- Given a 1-hypercover `E : J.OneHypercover X` of an object of `C`, a functor `F : C ‚•§ D`
such that `E.IsPreversedBy F K` for a Grothendieck topology `K` on `D`, this is
the image of `E` by `F`, as a 1-hypercover of `F.obj X` for `K`. -/
@[simps toPreOneHypercover]
```

```suggestion
lemma op_comp_isSheaf [Functor.IsContinuous.{t} F J K] (G : Sheaf K A) :
    Presheaf.IsSheaf J (F.op ‚ãô G.val) :=
  fun T => F.op_comp_isSheafOfTypes J K ‚ü®_, G.cond T‚ü©
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Sites): functors preserving 1-hypercovers are continuous

source.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Sites): under certain conditions, cover preserving functors preserve 1-hypercovers
[Merged by Bors] - feat: morphisms of presheaves that are locally injective for a Grothendieck topology
